{"step_by_step_thinking": "SIRT2 is a member of the sirtuin family of proteins, which are known to regulate cellular processes such as aging, transcription, apoptosis, inflammation and stress resistance. Some studies have shown that SIRT2 may play a role in various types of cancer, including cervical cancer, by regulating cell proliferation and apoptosis. Therefore, it can be said that SIRT2 has been associated with cervical cancer.", "answer_choice": "A"}
